title: Baltic Identity
content:
Any ideas on what typeface Baltic are using for their logo?

Can anyone point me towards the website which scans a typeface for a match?

Cheers

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185850/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_15.png) | 55.36 KB |

 [‹ (x) Southlake logo script - Voluta Script, Adobe Jenson {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185850/http:/typophile.com/node/16500 "Go to previous forum topic") [Madonna logo on "Confessions on a Dancefloor" CD-cover ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185850/http:/typophile.com/node/16502 "Go to next forum topic")
author: marc

comments.content: It actually looks like [Helvetica Extra Compressed](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185850/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/F/HLVQ/F_HLVQ-30005000.html) with softer edges.

We just had this ID and the conclusion is that it is custom based on woodblock types from the 1940s.

What is this Baltic everyone is so interested in?

[http://www.typophile.com/node/16311](http://web.archive.org/web/20080612185850/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16311 "http://www.typophile.com/node/16311")
